other_tests.findings: Initial echocardiogram showed minimal effusion of the free pericardium wall (5 mm) with fibrin presence.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Follow-up echocardiogram showed increased pericardial effusion (20 mm).

other_tests.findings: 900 ml of serum-hematic liquid evacuated; culture and cytological examinations were negative.
Initial blood tests were within normal ranges; subsequent tests revealed increased inflammation index (CRP 170 mg/L, ESR 80 mm/h, white blood cell count 10,750/mm3, neutrophils 7,920/mm3).
other_tests.changes_over_time: Last visit blood tests were within normal ranges.

other_tests.findings: Electrocardiogram at initial visit was negative.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Last visit electrocardiogram results were within the normal range.
